topic.title: Accessing and Using the Freezer UI

body.section: Accessing the UIThe Freezer UI can be accessed via the Horizon UI interface. See Horizon access instructions below.

Please look for OS_AUTH_URL in service.osrc located at /home/stack/. Once logged in as "hlm_backup", navigate to "Disaster Recovery" panel located at left hand menu where you should see "Backup and Restore"
Q: What login/password should we use:
A: The only supported user in HOS2.1 is "hlm_backup". The login credentials are available in backup.osrc located at /opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/

Backup and Restore Operations Supported in the UI
The following Operations are supported via the UI
Ability to create new jobs to Backup/Restore files
List the freezer jobs that have completed
Create sessions to link multiple jobs
List the various nodes ( hosts/servers) on which the freezer-scheduler and freezer agent are installed

Limitations The following limitations apply to Freezer Backups in HPE Helion OpenStack:
Recovery of the following services (or cloud topologies) will be partially supported as they need additional data (other than MySQL DB) to return to fully functional.
ESX Cloud
Ceph Cloud
Network services - LBaaS and VPNaaS
Logging data (that is, log files)
